Product.Introduction:
Our fascinating excursion starts from the Capital of Bahrain, where we will explore a contrast between the past and present. You can discover several attractions you are looking for. Our special tour is a combination of sightseeing, history, culture and heritage of the kingdom of Bahrain.

While in Manama, visit the Al-Fateh Grand Mosque, Bahrain National Museum, Bahrain Financial Harbor, Bahrain World Trade Center, to Bahrain Fort, and Bab Al-Bahrain where you will have spectacular views of Manama sights, the skyscrapers of downtown Manama.

We will take you to visit the old traditional houses in Muharraq, the most glamorous neighborhoods and show you the former Capital of Bahrain and then take a round in Amwaj Islands where we can find the traditional Bahraini architecture mixed with modern touches.

Complete your wonderful city tour experience spending the afternoon shopping at Manama Old Bazaar and Spice Bazaar.

This is private tour for 8 hours and max. 3 persons.

The below attraction will be visited during the tour:
• Al-Fateh Grand Mosque.
• Bahrain National Museum.
• Drive by Bahrain Financial Harbor, Bahrain World Trade Center.
• Bahrain Fort.

Product.ProductText:
Our fascinating excursion starts from the Capital of Bahrain, where we will explore a contrast between the past and present. You can discover several attractions you are looking for. Our special tour is a combination of sightseeing, history, culture and heritage of the kingdom of Bahrain.

While in Manama, visit the Al-Fateh Grand Mosque, Bahrain National Museum, Bahrain Financial Harbor, Bahrain World Trade Center, to Bahrain Fort, and Bab Al-Bahrain where you will have spectacular views of Manama sights, the skyscrapers of downtown Manama.

We will take you to visit the old traditional houses in Muharraq, the most glamorous neighborhoods and show you the former Capital of Bahrain and then take a round in Amwaj Islands where we can find the traditional Bahraini architecture mixed with modern touches.

Complete your wonderful city tour experience spending the afternoon shopping at Manama Old Bazaar and Spice Bazaar.

The Bahrain National Museum is the place where illustrate the real Bahraini tradition, culture, history, hand crafts and the life before from more than 3000BC ages till we discovered the oil in Bahrain.

Guided tour and walk around the fort.
Bahrain Fort, is an archaeological site located in Bahrain. Archaeological excavations carried out since 1954 have unearthed antiquities from an artificial mound of 12 m (39 ft) height containing seven stratified layers, created by various occupants from 2300 BC up to the 18th century- It was once the capital of the Dilmun civilization and was inscribed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2005.

Duration: 1 hour 30 minutes

Guided tour.

Guided tour.
This will be our first stop where we would take pictures of you.
Ahmed Al-Fateh Mosque is located in Manama, Bahrain's capital, and is part of an Islamic center. The center includes the mosque, a department for Qur'anic studies and an Islamic library. Construction work of Ahmed Al-Fateh Center began in 1984. It was opened in 1988 by the late Amir of Bahrain, Sheikh Isa bin Salman Al-Khalifa. The mosque occupies an area of 6,500 square meters and it can accommodate up to 7000 worshippers.

Guided tour.
Bahrain Fort- guided tour in Bahrain fort. Known as the Bahrain Fort, is an archaeological site located in Bahrain. Archaeological excavations carried out since 1954 have unearthed antiquities from an artificial mound of 12 m (39 ft) height containing seven stratified layers, created by various occupants from 2300 BC up to the 18th century, It was once the capital of the Dilmun civilization and was listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2005.

Duration: 1 hour

The Bahrain World Trade Center is a 240-metre-high, 50-floor, twin tower complex located in Manama, Bahrain. Designed by the multi-national architectural firm Atkins, construction on the towers was completed in 2008. It is the first skyscraper in the world to integrate wind turbines into its design.

Bahrain Financial Harbour is a waterfront commercial development project located on the northern shore of Manama, the capital city of Bahrain. Costing $1.5 billion and covering an area of 380,000 square metres, the two main Harbour Towers were officially opened in May 2007.

Product.Introduction:
Since that time, pearl diving has been taken as a profession for some families and a main source of income, powering the whole economy while leaving an unforgettable legacy in Bahrain. Today, Bahrain continues to keep this heritage alive and long lasting, making it a key attraction for both locals and foreigners to enjoy.

Collecting oysters in search of finding a precious pearl, is an excitement that divers feel and cherish, especially after a hard day’s work. Collecting and cracking oysters open requires strength, patience, good eye sight and of course time in order to find that beautiful round plump pearl. The feeling of catching and finding a pearl is indescribable, making you feel proud to have achieved a task that was and still is a heritage brought up by our ancestors and is a pride to our Kingdom, Bahrain.

Our professional dive instructors will guide you through this experience whether you are a beginner (snorkeling) or a certified diver (3 dive sites that you can choose from).

We offer you the opportunity to hunt for pearls right here in the amazing waters of Bahrain.

Our professional dive instructors will guide you through this experience whether you are a beginner or a certified diver.

Product.Introduction:
Have you always wondered what it’s like to breathe underwater? Discover Scuba Diving is a quick and easy introduction to what it takes to explore the underwater world. No prior experience with scuba diving is necessary, but you need to be in reasonable physical health.

You learn the basic safety guidelines and skills needed to dive under the direct supervision of one of our PADI Instructors. Get ready to:

1. Go over the scuba equipment you use to dive and how easy it is to move around underwater with your gear.
2. Find out what it’s like to breathe underwater.
3. Learn key skills that you’ll use during every scuba dive.
4. Have fun swimming around and exploring.
5. Hear about becoming a certified diver through the PADI Open Water Diver course.

Scubalife will provide all the basic scuba gear you’ll use including a mask, snorkel, fins, regulator, buoyancy control device, dive gauges and a tank.

Itinerary

Have you always wondered what it’s like to breathe underwater? If you want to try scuba diving, but aren’t quite ready to take the plunge into a certification course, Discover Scuba Diving is for you. Experience Bahrain offers this program. While not a scuba certification course, Discover Scuba Diving is a quick and easy introduction to what it takes to explore the underwater world.

No prior experience with scuba diving is necessary, but you need to be in reasonable physical health.

You learn the basic safety guidelines and skills needed to dive under the direct supervision of one of our PADI Instructors.

Experience Bahrain will provide all the basic scuba gear you’ll use including a mask, snorkel, fins, regulator, buoyancy control device, dive gauges and a tank.

Product.Introduction:
One of our sailing instructors will take you on a ride in the high octane SB20 race sailboat. The SB20 is an open keelboat that is designed for racing with a crew of 3 or 4. With a high aspect ratio keel with a very high ballast ratio the yacht is very stable, but also quite fast due to the substantial sail area. You will enjoy the ride whether you are a beginner or have sailing experience.

Product.Introduction:
You meet us at the Bahrain Yacht Club and we welcome you aboard, cast off the lines and set off into blue and head to Cut Wreck. There you will plunge into the water to view one of the most popular shipwrecks in Bahrain. It is a steel ship wreck that had collision with the shallow reef long time ago. With water depths between 3-5 meters, the wreck is easily and safely viewed while snorkelling on the surface.

Itinerary
This is a typical itinerary for this product

Join us on our snorkel boat for a ride from the Bahrain Yacht Club to Cut Wreck where you will plunge into the water to view one of the most popular shipwrecks in Bahrain. It is a steel ship wreck that had collision with the shallow reef long time ago. With water depths between 3-5 meters, the wreck is easily and safely viewed while snorkeling on the surface.

Duration: 1 hour

Product.ProductName: Two Sides to Muharraq Sea Tour (where tradition meets modernity)
Product.Introduction:
Discover a different view of Bahrain!

You meet us at Amwaj Marina, full of expectation of the adventure that lies ahead. We welcome you aboard, cast off the lines and set off into blue. Our tour heads south past Bahrain's new waterside developments and onto Bahrain's Sheikh Khalifa Port. Heading northwards again we journey under the Sh. Khalifa Bin Salman bridge to see the centuries old Arad Fort and Bahrain traditional dhow building yards. We cross under the Sh. Hamed bridge - which, in the 1940s was a swing bridge opening to trading dhows traveling from Mina Salman through to Mina Manama. We then view an area that is home to Bahrain's local inshore fisherman before traveling under the Sheikh Isa Causeway and into Bahrain's northern open waters. We travel east past the Diyar Al Muharraq development before turning into Amwaj Islands and home again to our marina.

You will return to shore with great memories and photos of a unique day out.

Itinerary
This is a typical itinerary for this product

Pass By: Dhow Building yard, 6JXC+42V, Muharraq, Bahrain

Discover a different view of Bahrain! Cruise along the coast of Manama to view the ever-changing skyline of this vibrant city.

Pass By: Arad Fort, Road No. 4233, Al Muharraq Bahrain

Arad Fort is a 15th-century fort.

Product.Introduction:
Take a ride on the latest towable, learn to fly underwater with Subwing, jet into the sky on fly board and blast off on one of our jet skis...

Location: Amwaj Marina

The package includes:

1. 30 minutes of Jet Ski

2. 20 minutes of Fly Boarding

3. 10 minutes of Towable Ride

4. 15 minutes of Subwing

Fuel your adrenaline and impress your friends if you dare-or just get cool on social media!

You meet us at our office located in Amwaj Marina, full of expectation of the advenutre that lies ahead. Our team will welcome you and take you to the beach, where your jet ski will be ready. Prior to your adventure, one of our experienced staff members will instruct you on the safe operation of your jet ski and the safe-riding zone.  After this briefing you will be fully informed. Our crew will be on standby in our riding area during your rental.  You will experience the thrill of blasting off on one of our jet skis for 30 minutes.

Following your jet ski adventure, you will discover the thrills of a flyboard.  On this 20-minute activity with Scubalife, a specially trained instructor will be your guide to ensure that you fly safely. We will try to take you up as high as you can to admire the views of Amwaj Islands. By the end of the session you might be able to dive like a dolphin.

After you learn to fly above the water, we will introduce you to the sensation of flying underwater with our latest water toy, Subwing.  You will be towed behind one of our jet skis for 15 minutes, where you can admire the underwater views in Amwaj Islands.

Finally, you will enjoy amusement park-quality thrills for 10 minutes with one of our ski tubes.  

You will return to shore with great memories and photos of a unique day out.

Fuel your adrenaline and impress your friends if you dare-or just get cool on social media!

You meet us at our office located in Amwaj Marina, full of expectation of the advenutre that lies ahead. Our team will welcome you and take you to the beach, where your jet ski will be ready. Prior to your adventure, one of our experienced staff members will instruct you on the safe operation of your jet ski and the safe-riding zone.  After this briefing you will be fully informed. Our crew will be on standby in our riding area during your rental.  You will experience the thrill of blasting off on one of our jet skis for 30 minutes.

Following your jet ski adventure, you will discover the thrills of a flyboard.  On this 20-minute activity with Scubalife, a specially trained instructor will be your guide to ensure that you fly safely. We will try to take you up as high as you can to admire the views of Amwaj Islands. By the end of the session you might be able to dive like a dolphin.

After you learn to fly above the water, we will introduce you to the sensation of flying underwater with our latest water toy, Subwing.  You will be towed behind one of our jet skis for 15 minutes, where you can admire the underwater views in Amwaj Islands.

You will then be taken on our custom built Axis T22 wakeboarding boat, where our British Water Ski and Wakeboard qualified instructors will take you all the way from standing up to throwing your first inverts. Using our state of the art Woo system, you will be able to track the progress of your heights, rotations and score your tricks and beat records. With our extreme watersports, you can get fit while having fun.

Our Axis T22 is the ideal boat for wakeboarding and wake surfing. It is equipped with ballast tanks, auto wedge and the revolutionary Surf Gate, which is widely seen as the best wave making technology around. The system means that we can adjust wake profiles to suit everyone from beginner to expert. 

Finally, you will enjoy amusement park-quality thrills for 10 minutes with one of our ski tubes.  

You will return to shore with great memories and photos of a unique day out.

Product.Introduction:
Discover the vibrant skyline of Bahrain!

You meet us at Amwaj Marina, full of expectation of the adventure that lies ahead. We welcome you aboard, cast off the lines and set off into blue. Our tour heads north around Diyar Al Muharraq past Sheikh Isa Causeway and on past Bahrain Bay with its iconic Four Seasons Hotel building. You will see Bahrain’s World Trade Centre with its triple turbines – an engineering feat documented on discovery channel. Cruising further we come to the Bahrain Financial Harbour, the country’s financial hub and site of the old Mina Manama Port. Cruising further we come to the luxurious Reef Island and further along the coastline to Seef District. As we return, depending on the time of day, we may witness the Dhow fleet streaming out of their harbor. off for their overnight fishing. We then retrace our path to Amwaj Islands and home again to our marina.

You will return to shore with great memories and photos of a unique day out.
